page.title: 18The King's Sutton Newspaper
page.content: The King's Sutton Times is a duplicated newspaper which is published by the Parish Council, four times a year, and distributed free to every house. It tells people what is happening in the village and gives some news, but most of all people can air their complaints. In the latest issue there are complaints about those who cannot be bothered to take their big rubbish to the Farthinghoe tip and dump it instead in Newbottle Woods, a favourite place for walks. Dog owners are taken to task for allowing their pets to run wild on the Rec etc. The Parish Council want the relatives of those buried in the Cemetery to volunteer to help keep the place tidier.
